APPARENT.Defintion: able to be seen or understood

ARMISTICE DAY.Defintion: November 11th, when the end of The First World War is celebrated

CAMARADERIE.Defintion: a feeling of friendliness towards people that you work or share an experience with

CARD.Defintion: (old fashioned) a funny or strange person

CONSENSUS.Defintion: a generally accepted opinion or decision among a group of people

CRITICS.Defintion: someone who says that they do not approve of someone or something

CROSSES.Defintion: the object that marks where soldiers were buried

CRUMPS.Defintion: the falling of shells from artillery

CURSING.Defintion: using a word or an expression that is not polite and shows that you are very angry

CYNIC.Defintion: people who believe that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere

CYNICAL.Defintion: believing that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere

DUST.Defintion: dry dirt in the form of powder that covers surfaces inside a building, or very small dry pieces of earth, sand, or other substances

ECHOES.Defintion: to express or think what someone else has said or thought

FLANDERS.Defintion: a region in the south-western part of the Low Countries, now divided between Belgium (where it forms the provinces of East and West Flanders), France, and the Netherlands. It was a powerful medieval principality and the scene of prolonged fighting during the First World War

FRONT LINE.Defintion: a place where opposing armies face each other in war and where fighting happens

FUTILE.Defintion: (of actions) having no effect or achieving nothing

FUTILITY.Defintion: (of actions) having no effect or achieving nothing

GENERAL.Defintion: military officers of the highest rank

GENERALS.Defintion: military officers of the highest rank

GIST.Defintion: the most important pieces of information about something, or general information without details

GRUNTED.Defintion: (of a pig) to make a low, rough noise

ICONIC.Defintion: very famous or popular, especially being considered to represent particular opinions or a particular time

INCOMPETENT.Defintion: not having the ability to do something as it should be done

INTANGIBLE.Defintion: impossible to touch, to describe exactly, or to give an exact value

KINDLING.Defintion: small dry sticks or other materials used to start a fire

LARK.Defintion: a small, brown bird that is known for its beautiful singing

LARKS.Defintion: a small, brown bird that is known for its beautiful singing

LICE.Defintion: a very small insect that lives on the bodies or in the hair of people and animals

LINE.Defintion: the line', in the context of World War One, was where the two sides fought against each other

LUMP.Defintion: put together in the same category

MACHINE GUN.Defintion: an automatic gun that can fire a lot of bullets one after the other very quickly

NERVE GAS.Defintion: a poisonous gas, often used as a weapon, that damages the nerves

NICHE.Defintion: interesting to, aimed at, or affecting only a small number of people

NO MAN'S LAND.Defintion: the land between the two sides in World War One

OPPONENTS.Defintion: a person you are competing against

OVER THE TOP.Defintion: (of World War One) to be sent towards the enemy

PATRIOTIC.Defintion: showing love for your country and being proud of it

POPPIES.Defintion: a plant with large, delicate flowers that are typically red and have small, black seeds

QUARREL.Defintion: an angry disagreement between two or more people or groups

RIPE OLD AGE.Defintion: (used here sarcastically) the condition of being very old; used especially to talk about someone who has a long healthy life

RUM.Defintion: a strong alcoholic drink made from the juice of the sugar cane plant

SENTIMENT.Defintion: a thought, opinion, or idea based on a feeling about a situation, or a way of thinking about something

SENTIMENTAL.Defintion: giving too much importance to emotions, especially love or sadness

SLAUGHTERED.Defintion: killed cruelly and unfairly, especially in a war

SLOGGED.Defintion: to travel or move with difficulty, for example through wet, sticky soil or snow, or when you are very tired

SMUG.Defintion: too pleased or satisfied about something you have achieved or something you know

SNEAK.Defintion: to go somewhere secretly, or to take someone or something somewhere secretly

SUPERIORS.Defintion: higher in rank or social position than others

SWINE.Defintion: a person who you consider to be extremely unpleasant and unkind

TELLING.Defintion: showing the truth about a situation or showing what someone really thinks

TRENCHES.Defintion: a deep hole dug by soldiers and used as a place from which they can attack the enemy while being hidden

UPBEAT.Defintion: full of hope, happiness, and good feelings

WHISTLED.Defintion: to make a high sound by forcing air through the lips
